Warnings.Descp: Found one or more vulnerable packages. [PKGS-7392]
klogd is not running, which could lead to missing kernel messages in log files [LOGG-2138]

Suggestion.Descp: Determine runlevel and services at startup [BOOT-5180]
Consider hardening system services [BOOT-5264]
Suggestion.Details: Run '/usr/bin/systemd-analyze security SERVICE' for each service

Suggestion.Descp: Determine why /vmlinuz or /boot/vmlinuz is missing on this Debian/Ubuntu system. [KRNL-5788]
If not required, consider explicit disabling of core dump in /etc/security/limits.conf file [KRNL-5820]

Configure password hashing rounds in /etc/login.defs [AUTH-9230]

Configure minimum password age in /etc/login.defs [AUTH-9286]
Configure maximum password age in /etc/login.defs [AUTH-9286]
Default umask in /etc/login.defs could be more strict like 027 [AUTH-9328]

Suggestion.Descp: Double check the permissions of home directories as some might be not strict enough. [HOME-9304]
One or more sysctl values differ from the scan profile and could be tweaked [KRNL-6000]
Suggestion.Solution: Change sysctl value or disable test (skip-test=KRNL-6000:<sysctl-key>)

Suggestion.Descp: Harden compilers like restricting access to root user only [HRDN-7222]
Harden the system by installing at least one malware scanner, to perform periodic file system scans [HRDN-7230]
Suggestion.Solution: Install a tool like rkhunter, chkrootkit, OSSEC
